statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -6 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ 5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ 12 \\ -16 \\ 31 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -4 \\ -6 \\ 2 \\ -5 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ -1 \\ 1 \\ -3 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -4 \\ -4 \\ 5 \\ -5 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 6 \\ 12 \\ -16 \\ 31 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
